title: Replace 2nd image in initial signup (login) page gallery with uploaded cal.png

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image file `cal.png` as a static frontend asset under `frontend/public/assets/` so it can be referenced at runtime without any resizing/cropping/styling changes.

quotes: on the Track Your Fitness Journey initial signup page there is an image gallery, please replace the 2nd image in the order with the attached
four in total and yes it should replace only the 2nd image

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/cal.png` exists and is served by the app at `/assets/cal.png`.

requirements.text: Update the initial signup page image gallery on `frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx` by replacing only the 2nd image in the `PREVIEW_IMAGES` array (currently `'/assets/main2a.png'`) to use the uploaded image at `'/assets/cal.png'`, keeping the gallery at 4 images and leaving the other 3 entries unchanged.

quotes: four in total and yes it should replace only the 2nd image

acceptanceCriteria: The `PREVIEW_IMAGES` array still contains exactly 4 images.
Only the second imageâ€™s `src` is changed to `'/assets/cal.png'`; the other three `src` values remain unchanged.
When navigating the carousel to image #2 (via arrows, swipe, or the 2nd dot), the displayed screenshot is the uploaded `cal.png`.

constraints: Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources).
Do not edit any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` within SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: No changes to carousel behavior, layout, or styling beyond swapping the referenced image file.
No cropping, resizing, or additional image processing of the uploaded image.
